info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 4:41PM EDT until June 16 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Central Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 441 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Downtown Concord to 8 miles southeast of Uptown Charlotte to 8 miles northwest of Indian Land, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Monroe, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings and Unionville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
